image:image.image:title: Buttons, note two scripts linked to ISO1 and ISO2 buttons, they're most important.
Heightmap and generated terrain according to it
frame prototype, first print, first success
arduino uno and mega screwed to inserts
arduino uno and mega screwed to inserts, put into frames
So what, we doing arduino cluster now?
PCB, halves of inserts for protoboard and step downs, universal one
pcb screwed in as well two step down converters
After measurements, prototype was modelled. Take note of the T-shaped elements inside triangular empty area.
Turned out great after first print, I like when eyeballing tolerances work.
Clamp test, it attaches to hub nicely and lock-itself subtly with the notch in the hub's case
Fit like a glove, hub assembled and secured in clamps with hinges mounted
Hinges in controller base, mounted to the T-shaped elements
Hub in its desired position, ready to receive some plugs.
camera screen and keyboard in question
I want them in pseudo-laptop configuration
How it looks in 3ds max (thats final version after all changes, ports, dongle holes etc incorporated)
ALMOST ready print, irl i had to re-print it due to small issues
Keyboard fits pretty nicely, also power switch is exposed so i can turn it on/off when needed
Hinges are designed to lock at flat 180degree, so it can be unfolded and used one-hand, like a portable console
Closed, man, i love PEI surface of my printer.
